sentence.Network_en: Bertha watched the lengthening days, the coloured crocus spring from the ground, the snowdrops.
sentence.Network_cn: 伯莎注意到那逐渐变长的白天, 注意到那些从地面冒出的五彩缤纷的藏红花和那些雪花莲属植物.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (also denoting saffron, obtained from a species of crocus): via Latin from Greek krokos, of Semitic origin and related to Hebrew karkōm and Arabic kurkum

entry.def: Crocuses are small white, yellow, or purple flowers that are grown in parks and gardens in the early spring.

means.word_mean: 1. any of numerous low-growing plants of the genus Crocus having slender grasslike leaves and white or yellow or purple flowers; native chiefly to the Mediterranean region but widely cultivated
